title: Carlo Ancelotti - Wikipedia
snippet: With his team's 2–1 victory over Real Sociedad on 17 September 2023, Ancelotti got his 173rd Madrid win, overtaking Zinedine Zidane to become the coach with the second most wins in the club's history. On 29 December, although he had previously been linked with the position of head coach for the Brazil national football team, Real Madrid announced that Ancelotti had agreed to a contract extension until 30 June 2026.

title: Carlo Ancelotti: All clubs, titles and records of the Italian star coach - full list
snippet: After eight at the helm, Ancelotti coached Chelsea, Paris Saint-Germain, Bayern Munich, Napoli, Everton and Real Madrid. ... Carlo Ancelotti has enjoyed great success in the UEFA Champions League.

title: Bio - Carlo Ancelotti
snippet: During this time he has won two Champions, two Intercontinental Cup, two European Supercups, three Serie A championship, four Italian Cups and one Italian Supercup. He participated in two World Cups too. Carlo starts his managerial career as Arrigo Sacchi’s assitant coach with itakian National ...

title: Carlo Ancelotti Manager Profile, Record & Stats | Premier League
snippet: Ancelotti’s coaching career began as assistant to Arrigo Sacchi with Italy’s 1994 FIFA World Cup finalists, before he moved into club management with Reggiana and Parma, later taking over at Juventus and then Milan.
